subject: Re: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4

messageBody:
Hi Kent,

On 10/4/05, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Cedric,
>
> If I need different sets of parameters for different tests, I put the
> tests
> in different classes. This way, tests don't see parameters they don't
> need.
> The same goes for fields set in a set-up method. Only tests that need
> exactly the same setup go in the same class.


Well, that's certainly the way it works in JUnit3, but I thought the whole
point behind the parameterized proposal was to allow tests to receive
parameters?

A lot of TestNG users like this feature, so that instead of passing, say,
the path of an XML file in the constructor and then referencing it in your
test method:

public VerifyXmlTest(String xmlPath) {
this.xmlPath = xmlPath;
}

public void testXml() {
// use this.xmlPath
}

You pass it directly to the test method:

public void testXml(String xmlPath) {
}

Cleaner, and it also features better isolation since you are not exposing
this parameter to test methods that don't need it.

--
Cédric
